alert.note: Alert for Reynolds (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 9:30PM CST until March 05 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Black River near Annapolis. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River near Annapolis. * WHEN...From Friday morning to Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Annapolis Road on the east bank of the Black River south of Lesterville begins flooding close to this height. This is the only road directly connecting Annapolis and Lesterville. At 9.0 feet, County Road 372 will begin flooding near this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM CST Thursday the stage was 4.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 11.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Black River Annapolis 8.0 4.0 8.4 6.7 5.7 5.2 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
